question_text:

  1. Do you think it is important who your friends are? 
  2. Which piece of advice from this Q&A article do you think is the best? Why?

How can you use one of the ideas from this text when you speak about your beliefs?

Do you think that Angela has the three characteristics you wrote down in the Warm-up? Why or why not?

  1. What do you think is the best way to make friends? 
  2. Which suggestion in the email do you think is the best? Why?

  1. Do you like to play games?  
  2. Would you like to join a club called Game Club? Why/Why not?

Would you like to receive a surprise like this for your birthday?

  1. What do you think is the best way to know if someone is interested in you romantically? 
  2. Do you think Karli should ask her classmate to go on a date with her?

Think about it...

  1. Look at the list of English words that you wrote during the warm-up. What words or phrases from the passage can you now add to your list?

  1. Are you aware of the food that you eat every day? 
  2. Do you agree that the foods mentioned in the article can give you more energy?

Think about it...

1. How are Sister Ellsworth’s experiences similar to your own experiences with serving others? How are her experiences different?

  1. When was the last time you went shopping during a sale? 
  2. Do you like to go shopping with family and friends, or alone?

What do you do to get free food or deals in your country?

  1. Would you consider starting a garden? 
  2. Do you think gardening would bring peace to your life?

Think about it...

  1. Is there a food bank in your area? How can you give food where you live? What food or other products might you give to help people in need? 
  2. What other things can you do to help people in need?

Think about it...

Would you be able to find your way to the café with the directions that Julie gave Jake?

Think about it...

  1. Would you be interested in moving into the Mirror House? Why or why not? 
  2. What kind of house or apartment would you most likely want to live in?

Think about it...

What is your opinion about social media?

Do you agree or disagree with Sam? Why?

Think about it...

1. What might be some reasons that “Mr. Perfect” left Lisa alone at the restaurant? What would you do in her situation?

Think about it...

Review the emails from Jill and Shelley. Do you think that Jill and Shelley are close friends? What did they write that gives you this opinion?

To 

jillgram@email.com 

Subject 

Going out tonight 

Hi Jill, 

 

Do you want to come with me and my roommates to dinner and a concert tonight? We are going to Luigi’s Pizza for dinner. After that, we will go over to the Jackson Auditorium. The Fairhope Symphony is playing tonight. They have amazing reviews. Also, one of my roommates’ sisters plays the violin in the symphony. She gave us free tickets! Hope you can make it! 

 

Shelley 

 

To 

shelleychan@email.com 

Subject 

Going out tonight 

Hi Shelley, 

 

Thanks for inviting me! I love classical music. But I have to work today until 4:00pm. What time are you meeting for dinner? Unfortunately, my car broke down yesterday. It is at the shop now. I can walk to Luigi’s Pizza. But where is the auditorium? If it’s far away, do you think I can get a ride with you? 

 

Jill

 

To 

jillgram@email.com 

Subject 

Going out tonight 

Hi Jill, 

 

We are meeting at Luigi’s Pizza at 5:00pm. Sorry I forgot to tell you! Then we will go to the concert at 7:00pm. The auditorium is all the way downtown. So, you can ride with me. Will that work? 

 

Shelley

 

To 

shelleychan@email.com 

Subject 

Going out tonight 

Hi Shelley, 

 

Yes, that sounds great. I am so excited to come tonight! Thank you again for inviting me. I will meet you at Luigi’s Pizza at 5:00pm! 

 

Jill

Think about it...

Have you ever seen cyberbullying online? How do you feel about cyberbullying? What can you do to stop it?

Think about it...

  1. If you were in Keisuke’s place, how would you respond to Dr. Bush’s request? 
  2. Have you ever helped a student in your class who was having difficulties learning? 
  3. Do you feel like you can rely on your teachers when you ask for help?

  2. What are some examples of sincere compliments?
